"*Vampires do(es)n't work that much anyway.*"  
- Posted By: Dilleux\_Lepaire (11/24/2008 7:07:31 PM)   
  
Hehe, that was pre Zendikar :D  
He could possibly even find some mediocre use in such a deck regarding cards like [Vampire Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nocturnus), [Malakir Bloodwitch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Malakir Bloodwitch) or [Blade of the Bloodchief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blade of the Bloodchief). And in case you run a non-Vapire for some reason ([Painter's Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter's Servant) for instance as mentioned before by metalvolence) he could help out including that guy as well.  
  
In general he can also be great in conjunction with "shooters". [Plague Spitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Spitter) should be the most awesome card for this, [Thrashing Wumpus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrashing Wumpus) will go nuts as well.  
[Goblin Sharpshooter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Sharpshooter) might also be handy, and some creatures like [Ashen Firebeast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashen Firebeast) and [Crypt Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crypt Rats) might find use as well (the latter if you can increase their toughness before). [Warmonger/aut](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warmonger/aut)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Diachronos (1/27/2012 5:10:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
seems like it would be a good finisher in an innistrad vampire deck. Your vamps get bigger if they hit and bigger if they are blocked, making your opponent have to make a lose/lose decision.   
  
Might need some support though, as that type of deck doesn't want to engage the opposing creatures until they have grown a bit.   
  
Hm... on second though, maybe not.
posts.html:
seems like it would be a good finisher in an innistrad vampire deck. Your vamps get bigger if they hit and bigger if they are blocked, making your opponent have to make a lose/lose decision.

Might need some support though, as that type of deck doesn't want to engage the opposing creatures until they have grown a bit.

Hm... on second though, maybe not.

Posted By: jsttu (11/7/2011 2:35:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Spikeshot Goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spikeshot Goblin) & [Spikeshot Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spikeshot Elder) absolutely love him, and [Kilnmouth Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kilnmouth Dragon) is basically a bigger, badder version of them.  
  
[Triskelion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Triskelion) is the classic, [Deathbringer Thoctar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathbringer Thoctar) is basically the same, but needs help to get the combo started, and [Spitting Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spitting Hydra) is a worse version of the same.  
  
[Caldera Hellion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Caldera Hellion) has very interesting and powerful synergy.  
  
You could make a decent casual black/red pinger deck based around this concept, though it would probably be better to focus it into a combo deck and pick something to work with the Vampire.
posts.html:
Spikeshot Goblin & Spikeshot Elder absolutely love him, and Kilnmouth Dragon is basically a bigger, badder version of them.

Triskelion is the classic, Deathbringer Thoctar is basically the same, but needs help to get the combo started, and Spitting Hydra is a worse version of the same.

Caldera Hellion has very interesting and powerful synergy.

You could make a decent casual black/red pinger deck based around this concept, though it would probably be better to focus it into a combo deck and pick something to work with the Vampire.

posts.post_content:
[Myr Servitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Servitor) is really awesome.  
So is [Kalastria Highborn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kalastria Highborn).  
So is [Phyrexian Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Altar).  
  
And because of what a kind person said in describing Myr Servitor's ability, assuming you have 3 on the field and one in the graveyard, you'll get 5 sacrifice effects. so, you'd do 10 dmg, get 10 life, and have four myr servitors on the field.  
  
Also, [Paradox Haze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paradox Haze).
